summary: This document is a chain of emails from December 2018 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing a prior 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reference the sharing of documents, including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 form, and mention a news article about Epstein's relationships with young women.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: An attorney who met with the U.S. Attorney's Office in 2016 regarding the Epstein case, forwarded a news article, and shared legal documents including a complaint and a redacted FBI 302.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Identified as a lead attorney on the Epstein case who was added to an email chain by Peter Skinner for follow-up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case, referenced in relation to a news article about his continued relationships with young women and the sharing of legal documents concerning him.

connections.description: Skinner identifies McCawley as a lead attorney on the Epstein case and adds her to an email chain for coordination.
Skinner is communicating with prosecutors and sharing legal documents related to the Epstein case.
McCawley is identified as a lead attorney on the Epstein case.

events.title: Page Six Article on Epstein
events.description: The New York Post's Page Six reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Meeting with U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: Attorney Peter Skinner meets with representatives from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Request for Meeting Notes
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office follows up on the 2016 meeting, requesting any notes or records from the meeting with Peter Skinner and inquiring about any subsequent meetings related to Epstein.

keyFacts: In March 2016, a Page Six article reported on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, which was forwarded to prosecutors by attorney Peter Skinner.

Attorney Peter Skinner shared several legal documents with the U.S. Attorney's Office in February 2016, including a complaint, declarations, a Rule 56.1 statement, and a redacted FBI 302 form related to Epstein.
Sigrid McCawley is identified in 2016 as a lead attorney on the Epstein case with knowledge of the facts.
In December 2018, the U.S. Attorney's Office was actively seeking notes and records from a 2016 meeting with Skinner to get a 'complete handle on the landscape' of the Epstein case.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing communication and document sharing between private attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein investigation years before his 2019 arrest.
